column5: Next weekend is the annual Stoney lake combo and wanted to know who's going.  All the best to all the teams see you guys there.
Do you still see walleye being weighed in during that tournament?
Yes but no big numbers
How would you weigh in with walleye? Anything worth weighing would be well over the keep slot.
Take a look at last year's results http://www.stoneylakecombo.com/results.html
Jer, it's only in the title.  no one really weighs in any walleye.  edit: i see the previous years are posted. You can see what I mean.
I weight a max length walleye in a tournament on Rice at 2.65 and max length walleye on Sturgeon are 3-3.10  so yes walleye are still good at the Stony Combo.
Good luck Bro. J
Going to give it a go and see what I come up with. It's 3 days of fishing so I'm happy

Not being a tourney guy what is a combo, 2 fish Bass and Pics or ? What do the numbers represent? Pounds, grams. length? The chart isn't clear on my laptop. I like to learn something about fishing whenever I can. I fish a few charity Walleye tournaments here on Erie every summer, lately the trend seems to have the largest Perch as a bonus prize. Lets the guys that can't get out 10 miles or more on big water participate.  Thanks. JD.
This might help J.D  http://www.stoneylakecombo.com/rules.html
Well good luck to all that are going to this tournament. Will see you guys on the water.
Been lots of boats running around this morning, but I just saw a big bolt of lightning over Stoney/Clear lakes so hopefully all the tourney guys are paying attention.
It was a hard day with the rain. Called it quits by 11am. From what I hear David Chong was in first place.
What a crazy weekend to be fishing in a tournament. Hope everyone was safe.
We all played it safe but some stayed out till the end. Other's came in with what they had by 11am
By the way it was nice seeing you again Lew always a pleasure talking to you. Thanks for the invite for coffee but we ended up hitting the water.
Good yakking with you on Friday too Jose  Coffee pots always on next time your up this way.

Our local combo tourney you are REQUIRED to weigh in 1 bass and 1 walleye or you can't weigh... 2 fish total...  So even if you get a giant walleye... If you don't weigh a bass you can't weigh... And vise versa...  That being said our area would actually be pretty even between the bass guys and walleye guys cause we have no slot...
I like the sounds of that Mike. When is that tournament?   Lew next time I will definitely stop bye and have that coffee with you.
It's held in late July every year... Me and my buddy took 1st this year... 10lbs 2oz.... 1 bass 1 walleye...
It was a hard day with the rain. Called it quits by 11am. From what I hear David Chong was in first place. Dave and his partner came in third
